problems.title: Sliding Window Maximum
problems.description:
You are given an array of integers nums, there is a sliding window of size k which is moving from the very left of the array to the very right. You can only see the k numbers in the window. Each time the sliding window moves right by one position.
Return the max sliding window.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and k.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print the maximum value in each window, space-separated.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
8 3
1 3 -1 -3 5 3 6 7

Sample Output
3 3 5 5 6 7

Explanation:
Window position -> Max
[1 3 -1] -> 3
[3 -1 -3] -> 3
[-1 -3 5] -> 5
[-3 5 3] -> 5
[5 3 6] -> 6
[3 6 7] -> 7
hintsList: Use a deque to maintain indices of useful elements in decreasing order of values.
Remove elements from back of deque that are smaller than current element, and remove from front if they are out of window.
